title: 中部 咒语 第3节
paragraphs: “是的，我说过，这是PDC的决议。”
“那我就和她们一起去末日。”
“可以。”
罗辑本以为会被拒绝，但同上次他要放弃面壁者身份一样，萨伊的回答几乎无缝隙地紧跟而来，他知道，事情远不像这个回答那么简单，于是问：“有什么问题吗？”

萨伊说：“没有，这次真的可以。你知道，从面壁计划诞生起，国际社会就一直存在着反对的声音，而且，不同的国家出于自己的利益，大都支持面壁者中的一部分而反对另一部分，总有想摆脱你的一方。现在，第一位破壁人的出现和泰勒的失败，使得面壁计划反对派的力量增强了，与支持力量处于僵持状态。如果你在这时提出直达末日的要求，无疑给出了一个双方都能接受的折衷方案。但，罗辑博士，你真的愿意这样做吗，在全人类为生存而战的时候？”
“你们政治家动辄奢谈全人类，但我看不到全人类，我看到的是一个一个的人。我就是一个人，一个普通人，担负不起拯救全人类的责任，只希望过自己的生活。”

“好吧，庄颜和你们的孩子也是这一个一个人中的两个，你也不想承担对她们的责任吗？就算庄颜伤害了你，看得出你仍然爱她，还有孩子。自从哈勃二号太空望远镜最后证实三体入侵以来，有一件事可以肯定：人类将抵抗到底。你的爱人和孩子在四个世纪后醒来时，将面临末日的战火，而那时的你，已经失去了面壁者身份，再也没有能力保护她们，她们只能和你一起，在地狱般的生活中目睹世界的最后毁灭，你愿意这样么，这就是你带给爱人和孩子的生活？”
罗辑无语了。
“你不用想别的，就想想四个世纪后，在末日的战火里，她们见到你时的目光吧！她们见到的是一个什么样的人？一个把全人类和自己最爱的人一起抛弃的人，一个不愿救所有的孩子，甚至连自己孩子也不想救的人。作为一个男人，你能承受这样的目光？”
罗辑默默低下头，夜雨落在湖边的草丛中，仿佛来自另一个时空的无数倾诉声。
“你们真的认为，我能改变这一切？”罗辑抬起头问。
“为什么不试试？在所有面壁者中，你很可能是最有希望成功的，我这次来，就是为了告诉你这个。”
“那你说吧，为什么选中我？”
“因为在全人类中，你是唯一一个三体文明要杀的人。”
罗辑靠着柱子，双眼盯着萨伊，其实他什么都没看见，他在极力回忆。
萨伊接着说：“那起车祸，其实是针对你的，只是意外撞中了你的女友。”
“可那次真的是一起意外车祸，那辆车是因为另外两辆车相撞而转向的。”
“他们为此准备了很长时间。”
“但那时我只是个没有任何保护的普通人，杀我很容易的，何必搞得这么复杂？”
“就是为了使谋杀像意外事故，不引起任何注意。他们几乎做到了，那一天，你所在的城市发生了五十一起交通事故，死亡五人。但潜伏在地球三体组织内部的侦察员有确切情报：这是ETO精心策划的谋杀！最令人震惊的是：指令直接来自三体世界，通过智子传达给伊文斯，这是迄今为止，它们发出的唯一的刺杀命令。”
“我吗？三体文明要杀我？原因呢？”罗辑再次对自己有一种陌生感。
“不知道，现在没有人知道，伊文斯可能知道，但他死了。谋杀指令中‘不引起任何注意’的要求显然是他附加的，这也进一步说明了你的重要性。”
“重要性，”罗辑摇头苦笑，“您看看我，真的像一个拥有超能力的人吗？”
“你没有超能力，也别向那方面想，那会使你误入歧途的！”萨伊抬起一只手以强调自己的话，“对你早有过专门研究，你没有超能力，不管是超自然能力，还是在已知自然规律内的超技术能力，你都没有，正如你所说：你是个普通人，作为学者你也是个普通的学者，没有什么过人之处，至少我们没有发现。伊文斯在谋杀令中附加的要求：不引起注意，也间接证明了这一点，因为这说明你的能力也可能被别人所拥有。”
“为什么不早告诉我这些？”
“怕影响到你可能拥有的那种能力，由于未知因素太多，我们认为最好能让你顺其自然。”
“我曾经打算从事宇宙社会学研究，因为……”这时，罗辑意识深处有一个声音轻轻说：你是面壁者！他是第一次听到自己的这个声音，他还仿佛听到了另一个并不存在的声音，那是在周围飞行的智子的嗡嗡声，他甚至好像看到了几个萤火虫般迷离的光点。第一次，罗辑做出了一个面壁者应有的举动，把要说的话咽了回去，只是说：“是不是与这个有关系？”
萨伊摇了摇头，“应该没有关系，据我们所知，这只是你提出的一个科研选题申请，研究还没有开始，更没有任何成果。况且，即使你真的从事了这项研究，我们也很难指望得到比其他学者更有价值的成果。”
“此话怎讲？”
“罗辑博士，我们现在的谈话只能是坦率的。据我们了解，你作为一名学者是不合格的，你从事研究，既不是出于探索的欲·望，也不是出于责任心和使命感，只是把它当做谋生的职业而已。”
“现在不都这样吗？”
“这当然无可厚非，但你有很多与一名严肃和敬业的学者不相称的行为：你做研究的功利性很强，常常以投机取巧为手段，哗众取宠为目的，还有过贪污研究经费的行为；从人品方面看，你玩世不恭，没有责任心，对学者的使命感更是抱着一种嘲笑的态度……其实我们都清楚，对人类的命运你并不在意。”
“所以你们用这种卑鄙的方式来要挟我……您一直轻视我，是吗？”巴州往事
“通常情况下，你这样的人是不可能承担任何重要职责的，但现在有一点压倒了一切：三体世界怕你。请你做自己的破壁人，找出这是为什么。”
萨伊说完，转身走下门廊，坐进了在那里等候的汽车，车开动后很快消失在雨雾中。三体小说
罗辑站在那里，失去了时间感。雨渐渐停了，风大了起来，刮走了夜空中的乌云，当雪山和一轮明月都露出来时，世界沐浴在一片银光中，在转身走进房门前，罗辑最后看了一眼这银色的伊甸园，在心里对庄颜和孩子说：“亲爱的，在末日等我吧。”

站在“高边疆”号空天飞机投下的大片阴影中，仰望着它那巨大的机体，章北海不由想起了“唐”号航空母舰，后者早已被拆解，他甚至有这样的想象：“高边疆”号机壳上是不是真的有几块“唐”号的钢板？经过三十多次太空飞行归来时再人大气层的燃烧，在“高边疆”号宽阔的机腹上留下了烧灼的色彩，真的很像建造中的“唐”号，两者有着几乎一样的沧桑感，只是机翼下挂着的两个圆柱形助推器看上去很新，像是欧洲修补古建筑时的做法：修补部分呈全新的与原建筑形成鲜明对比的色彩，以提醒参观者这部分是现代加上的。确实，如果去掉这两个助推器，“高边疆”号看上去就像是一架古老的大型运输机。
空天飞机其实是很新的东西，是这五年航天技术不多的突破之一，同时也可能是化学动力航天器的最后一代了。空天飞机的概念在上世纪就已经提出，是航天飞机的换代产品，它可以像普通飞机一样从跑道起飞，以常规的航空飞行升至大气层顶端，再启动火箭发动机开始航天飞行，进入太空轨道。“高边疆”号是目前已经投入使用的四架空天飞机中的一架，更多的空天飞机正在建造中，将在不久的未来担负起建造太空电梯的任务。
“本来以为，我们这辈子没机会上太空了，”章北海对前来送行的常伟思说，他将和其他二十名太空军军官一起，乘坐“高边疆”号登上国际空间站，他们都是三个战略研究室的成员。
“有没出过海的海军军官吗？”常伟思笑着问。
“当然有，很多。在海军中，有人谋求的就是不出海，但我不是这种人。”
“北海啊，你还应该清楚一点：现役航天员仍属于空军编制，所以，你们是太空军中第一批进入太空的人。”
“可惜没什么具体任务。”
“体验就是任务嘛，太空战略的研究者，当然应该有太空意识。空天飞机出现以前这种体验不太可能，上去一个人花费就是上千万，现在便宜多了，以后要设法让更多的战略研究人员上太空，我们毕竟是属于太空的军种，现在呢，太空军竟像一个空谈的学院了，这不行。”
这时，登机指令发出，军官们开始沿舷梯上机，他们都只穿作训服，没有人穿航天服，看上去只是要进行一次普通的航空旅行。这种情形是进步的标志，至少表明进入太空比以前稍微寻常了一些。章北海从服装上注意到，登机的除了他们外还有其他部门的人。
“哦，北海，还有一件重要的事。”在章北海提起自己的配备箱时，常伟思说，“军委已经研究了我们呈报的关于政工干部增援未来的报告，上级认为现在条件还不成熟。”
章北海眯起了双眼，他们处于空天飞机的阴影中，他却像看到了刺眼的强光：
“首长，我感觉，应该把四个世纪的进程当做一个整体，应该分清什么是紧急的，什么是重要的……不过请你放心，我不会在正式场合这么说，我当然清楚，上级有更全面的考虑。”
“上级肯定了你这种长远的思考方式，并提出表扬。文件上强调了一点：增援未来计划没有被否决，计划的研究和制定仍将继续进行，只是目前执行的条件还不成熟。我想，当然只是自己的想法，可能要等更多合格的政工干部充实进来，使目前的工作压力减轻一些再考虑此事吧。”
“首长，你当然清楚，对太空军政工干部而言，所谓合格，最基本的要求是要具备什么，现在这样的人不是越来越多，而是越来越少。”
“但也要向前看，如果第一阶段的两项关键技术：太空电梯和可控核聚变取得突破——这在我们这一代可见的未来应该是有希望吧——情况就会好些……好了，在催你了。”
章北海向常伟思敬礼后，转身走上舷梯。进入机舱后，他的第一感觉就是这里与民航客机没有太大差别，只是座椅宽了许多，这是为穿航天服乘坐而设计的。
在空天飞机最初的几次飞行中，为防万一，起飞时乘员都要穿航天服，现在则没有这个必要了。
章北海坐到一个靠窗的座位上，旁边的座位上立刻也坐上一个人，从服装看他不是军人。章北海冲他简单地点头致意后，就专心致志地系着自己座位上复杂的安全带。
没有倒计时，“高边疆”号就启动了航空发动机，开始起飞滑行，由于重量很大，它比一般飞机的滑跑距离要长，但最后还是沉重地离开地面，踏上了飞向太空的航程。
“这是‘高边疆’号空天飞机第三十八次飞行，航空飞行段开始，约持续三十分钟，请不要解开安全带。”扩音器中的一个声音说。
从舷窗中看着向下退去的大地，章北海想起过去的日子。在航母舰长培训班中，他经历了完整的海军航空兵飞行员训练，并通过了二级战斗机飞行员的考核。
在第一次放单飞时，他也是这样看着离去的大地，突然发现自己喜欢蓝天要甚于海洋，现在，他更向往蓝天之上的太空了。
他注定是一个向高处飞、向远方去的人。
“与乘民航没什么两样，是吗？”
章北海扭头看坐在旁边的说话的人，这才认出他来：“您是丁仪博士吗？啊，久闻大名！”
“不过一会儿就难受了……”丁仪没有理会章北海的敬意，继续说，“第一次，我在航空飞行完了后没摘眼镜，眼镜就像砖头那么沉地压在鼻粱上；第二次倒是摘了，可失重后它飞走了，人家好不容易才帮我在机尾的空气过滤网上找到。”
“您第一次好像是乘航天飞机上去的吧？从电视上看那次旅程好像不太愉快。”章北海笑着说。
“啊，我说的是乘空天飞机的事儿，要算上航天飞机，这是第四次了，航天飞机那次眼镜起飞前就被收走了。”
“这次去空间站做什么呢，您刚被任命为可控核聚变的项目负责人，好像是第三研究分支吧？”
可控核聚变项目设立了四个研究分支，分别按不同的研究方向进行。
丁仪在安全带的束缚下抬起一只手指点着章北海：“研究可控核聚变就不能上太空？你怎么和那些人一个论调？我们的最终研究目标是宇宙飞船的发动机，现在在航天界掌握实权的，有很大比例是以前搞化学火箭发动机的人，可现在，照他们的意思，我们只应该老老实实在地面搞可控核聚变，对太空舰队的总体规划没有多少发言权。”
“丁博士，在这一点上我和您的看法完全相同。”章北海把安全带松了一下，探过身去说，“太空舰队的宇宙航行与现在的化学火箭航天根本不是一个概念，就是太空电梯也与现在的航天方式大不相同，可如今，过去的航天界还在这个领域把持着过大的权力，那些人思想僵化墨守成规，这样下去后患无穷。”
“没办法，人家毕竟在五年内搞出了这个，”丁仪四下指指，“这更给了他们排挤外人的资本。”
这时，舱内扩音器又响了：“请注意：现在正在接近两万米高度，由于后面的航空飞行将在稀薄大气中进行，有可能急剧掉落高度，届时将产生短暂失重，请大家不要惊慌。重复一遍：请系好安全带。”
丁仪说：“不过我们这次去空间站真的和可控核聚变项目无关，是要把那些宇宙射线捕捉器收回来，都是些很贵的东西。”
“空间高能物理研究项目停了。”章北海边重新系紧自己的安全带边问。
“停了，知道以后没必要白费力气，也算一个成果吧。”
“智子胜利了。”
“是啊，现在，人类手里就这么点儿理论储备了：古典物理、量子力学、加上还在娘胎中的弦论，在应用上能走多远，听天由命吧。”
“高边疆”号继续爬高，航空发动机发出吃力的隆隆声，像在艰难地攀登一座高峰，但掉高度的现象没有发生，空天飞机正在接近三万米，这是航空飞行的极限。章北海看到，外面蓝天的色彩正在褪去，天空黑下来，但太阳却更加耀眼了。
“现在飞行高度31000米，航空飞行段结束，即将开始航天飞行段，请各位按显示屏上的图例调整自己的坐姿，以减轻超重带来的不适。”
这时，章北海感到飞机轻轻上升了一下，像是抛掉了什么负担。
“航空发动机组脱离，航天发动机点火倒计时：10、9、8……”
“对他们来说，这才开始真正的发射，好好享受吧。”丁仪说，随即闭上眼睛。
倒计时到零以后，巨大的轰鸣声响起，听起来仿佛外部的整个天空都在怒吼，超重像一个巨掌把一切渐渐攥紧。章北海吃力地转头看舷窗外面，从这里看不到发动机喷出的火焰，但外面空气已经很稀薄的天空被映红了一大片，“高边疆”号仿佛飘浮在稀薄的晚霞中。
五分钟后，助推器脱离，又经过五分钟的加速，主发动机关闭，“高边疆”号进入太空轨道。

超重的巨掌骤然松开，章北海的身体从深陷的座椅中弹出来，安全带的束缚使他飘不起来，但在感觉中他已经与“高边疆”号不再是一个整体，粘接他们的重力消失了，他和空天飞机在太空中平行飞行着。从舱窗望出去，他看到了有生以来见过的最明亮的星空。后来，空天飞机调整姿态，阳光从舷窗中射入，光柱中有无数亮点在舞蹈，这是因失重升起的大颗粒尘埃。随着飞机的缓缓旋转，章北海看到了地球，在这个低轨道位置，看不到完整的球体，只能看到弧形的地平线，但大陆的形状清楚地显现出来。接着，星海又出现了，这是章北海最渴望看到的，他在心里说：
“爸爸，我走出了第一步。”
这五年来，斐兹罗将军觉得自己更像实际意义上的面壁者，他所面对的墙壁就是大屏幕上三体世界方向的星空照片，照片粗看一片黑暗，细看有星光点点。

对于这一片星空。斐兹罗已经很熟悉了，昨天，在一次无聊的会议上，他曾试着在纸上画出那些星星的位置，之后和实际照片对照，基本正确。三体世界的三颗恒星处于正中，很不显眼，如果不进行局部放大，看上去只是一颗星，但每次放大后就会发现，三颗星的位置较上次又有了变化，这种随机的宇宙之舞令他着迷，以至于忘了自己最初是想看到什么。五年前观测到的第一把“刷子”已经渐渐淡化了，至今，第二把“刷子”仍未出现。三体舰队只有穿过星际尘埃云时才能留下可观察的尾迹，地球天文学家通过观察对背景星光的吸收，在三体舰队长达四个世纪的航程要穿越的太空中，已探明了五片尘埃云。现在，人们把这些尘埃云称做“雪地”，其含义是雪地上能够留下穿越者的痕迹。
如果三体舰队在五年中恒定加速，今天就要穿越第二块“雪地”了。
斐兹罗早早来到了哈勃二号太空望远镜控制中心，林格看到他笑了起来。
“将军，您怎么像个圣诞刚过又要礼物的孩子？”
“你说过今天要穿越‘雪地’的。”FictionForest
“不错，但三体舰队目前只航行了0.22光年，距我们还有4光年，反映其穿越‘雪地’的光线要四年后才能到达地球。”
“哦，对不起，我忘了这点。”斐兹罗尴尬地摇摇头，“我太想再次看到它们了，这次能测出它们穿越时的速度和加速度，这很重要。”
“没办法，我们在光锥之外。”
“什么？”
“光的传播沿时间轴呈锥状，物理学家们称为光锥，光锥之外的人不可能了解光锥内部发生的事件。想想现在，谁知道宇宙中有多少重大事件的信息正在以光速向我们飞来，有些可能已经飞了上亿年，但我们仍在这些事件的光锥之外。”
“光锥之内就是命运。”
林格略一思考，赞赏地冲斐兹罗连连点头，“将军，这个比喻很好！”
“可是智子就能在光锥之外看到锥内发生的事。”
“所以智子改变了命运。”斐兹罗感慨地说，同时朝一台图像处理终端看了看。五年前，那个叫哈里斯的年轻工程师在那里工作，看到“刷子”后他哭了起来，后来这人患上严重的抑郁症，几乎成了个废人，被中心辞退了，现在也不知流落何方。
好在像他这样的人还不多。

translated_paragraphs: Yes, I have said that this is the PDC resolution.
I'll go with them to the end of the world.
Yes.
As he had expected, the wall refused to open. But this time Sai answered almost immediately, knowing that things weren't as simple as it seemed; he asked, "Any questions?"

Sai said, “No, this time it can really happen. You know, since the Plan to Break the Wall was born, there have been voices of opposition from international society and countries, in which different sides support a part of Breakers while opposing another, with some wanting to rid themselves of you. Now that the first Break-Wall Man has appeared and Taylor failed, the strength of the Plan's opponents is increasing, but both sides are still at a standstill. If you make this proposal now, it will be a compromise solution accepted by both sides.”

“Your politicians talk about humanity, but I don’t see the whole of humanity. What I see is each individual person. I am just one person and cannot fulfill the task to save humanity, all I want is to live my own life.”

“Well, you and your children are also just one person among many. Wouldn't you rather not take responsibility for them?” “Even if Zhuo Rong injured you, it's clear that you still love her and the child. Since Hubble Space Telescope confirmed the invasion by Trisolaris, there is one thing we can be sure of: humanity will resist to the end. When your lover and child wake up in four centuries and find themselves in the midst of a war of extinction, you won't be able to protect them anymore as a face-mancer. They will just have to share the hellish life with you, witnessing the end of the world.”
I'm speechless.

“Don't think about anything else. Just imagine the look on their faces when they see you in the end of the world, as a man who abandoned the whole humanity and loved ones along with it, as someone who wouldn't save all the children but not even wanted to save his own children. Can you stand that kind of stare?”
Rou Quan quietly lowered his head, as the raindrops fell silently on the grass by the lake. The sound of numerous voices seemed to come from another world, in that quiet night.
“Do you really think I can change all this?” LuoJi asked as he looked up.
“Why not give it a try? You are probably the one with the best chance to succeed. I came here just to tell you that.”
"So, why did you choose me?"
“Because in the entire human race, you are the only one that the Trisolaran civilization wants to kill.”
Roland stood against a pillar, staring at Sai without actually seeing anything. He was desperately trying to remember.
That accident, which hit your girlfriend, was actually a plot against you.
That was really just an accidental car crash. That car turned because of two other cars colliding with each other.
They had been preparing for a long time.
But at that time, I was just an ordinary person without any protection. It was easy to kill me then, why make it so complicated?

They almost accomplished their objective. That day, fifty traffic accidents occurred in the city where you live and five people died. But a surveillance agent inside the ETO has firsthand information that it is a murder undertaken by them! The most shocking thing is that this order comes directly from three-dimensional alien space, transmitted to Ivan via Zhiqiu and is the only assassination order they have sent so far.
“Why do you think the Three-Body Civilization is going to kill me?” Luo Qiang asked himself.

“No one knows, Evans might have known but he's dead. The request to avoid attention in the murder instructions was clearly an additional requirement added by him and that further demonstrates your importance.”
“Importance, ” Luo Ze shook his head bitterly, “do you really think I look like someone with superpowers?”

Sai raised his hand to emphasize what he said, “You don’t have supernatural powers or any advanced technology, as you mentioned yourself. This means you can never be anything more than an ordinary person and a scholar who is not remarkable in any way. Even if Ivinus did attach additional requirements, it also proves that this indicates that your capabilities may be possessable by others. ”
Why didn't you tell me these earlier?
We believe it's best to leave you alone so as not to interfere with the potential powers you may possess due to unforeseen factors.

“I had intended to study cosmological sociology because……” At this point, the voice in his subconscious whispered softly. “You are a face waller!” For the first time, he heard that sound in his mind, as if it were coming from nearby flying intelligent particles and even saw a few indistinct glowing spots like fireflies in the night sky. First of all, the face waller made the correct move by holding back what he wanted to say. Instead, he asked, “Is this related?”

Said nodded his head, “I don't think there should be a problem. As far as we know, this is just an application for the research project you have proposed. It's also worth noting that even if you do end up working on this research project, it will be hard to expect us to receive more valuable results than other scholars.”

Dr. Luo, we can only have an honest conversation with you now. Based on what we know, you are not qualified as a scholar. You engage in research without either exploring curiosity or feeling a sense of responsibility and mission, but rather just considering it as your job for making a living.
“Isn't it like this now?”

“This is certainly understandable, but you have many behaviors that are not appropriate for a serious and dedicated scholar: you conduct research primarily for personal profit, often using unscrupulous tactics to engage publicity and make a quick buck; your character also shows no responsibility for the mission of being a scholar, instead holding a contemptuous attitude towards it……We all know that you don't really care about human fate.”
"So you are using this underhanded way to blackmail me ... Do you always disrespect me like that, is it?"
“In general, people like you are not qualified to hold important responsibilities. However, there is one thing that overrides all of them: the Three-Body universe fears you.”
Sai said, turned and walked down the porch, sat in the car that waited there, and soon disappeared into the rain fog. 3)《红海行动》 （2018年上映）

$Roland stood there, losing track of time. The rain gradually stopped, and the wind grew stronger, sweeping away the dark clouds in the night sky, as snow-capped mountains and a round moon revealed themselves in the silver light. Before stepping into his room, Roland looked back once more at this silvery Eden, thinking to himself about Zhuang Yan and their child: “My dear ones, I will meet you again on that day.

Standing under the shadow of the "Gao Bianjiang" spacecraft, looking up at its huge body, Zhang Beihai could not help thinking about the "Tang" aircraft carrier that had been dismantled and torn apart. He even imagined that there might be pieces of the steel plate from the "Tang" aircraft carrier on the shell of the "Gao Bianjiang" spacecraft: after returning to Earth, the burning flames left marks of destruction on its broad belly, and it looked very similar to the "Tang", only the two pillar-shaped boosters attached under the wings looked brand new as if they were modern additions to the original building. Indeed, if you removed those two boosters, the "Gao Bianjiang" spacecraft would look like an old large transport aircraft.

The empty-sky aircraft is a relatively new thing, and it's one of the breakthroughs in space technology in recent years. It can also be considered as the last generation chemical propellant rocket in orbit. The concept of empty-sky aircraft was first proposed back in the 20th century, which is the replacement product of conventional spacecrafts that can take off from an airfield like a regular aircraft, ascend to the edge of the atmosphere and then start the rocket engine to enter the orbit. "Haibei" is one of the four empty-sky aircraft currently in service, and more are under construction, which will be responsible for building a space elevator in the near future.

“I thought we would never get to go into space in our lifetime, ” said Zhang Beihai to his colleague Chang Weisi, who was there to bid them farewell before the voyage on board the High Boundary. “We’re all 20 members of the strategic research branch here.”
“Do you know any naval officers who have been to sea?” 常伟思 asked with a smile.
Of course, there are many. In the navy, some people don't want to go out of sea, but I am not like that.
North Sea, you should be clear about this. Currently serving astronauts still belong to the Air Force, so that you are the first batch of people to enter space in the Space Army.
“Sorry, there are no specific tasks.”

“Experience is a task, of course, space strategists should have space awareness. Before the arrival of spaceplanes, this kind of experience was unlikely to happen, since it cost thousands or millions to send one person up there. Now, things are cheaper and we need to find ways to let more space strategists go to space; after all, we are a military branch belonging to space. Currently, the Space Army looks like a mere academic organization rather than an operational force. This is not acceptable.”
Chapter North Sea noticed from the clothes that there were other departments' people aside from them.

“Oh, there’s an important matter,” said Chang Beihai as he picked up his kitbag. “The army command has studied the report we submitted regarding our suggestion to supply additional political officers for future needs and feels that now is not the time.”
Chen Beihai closed his eyes, they were in the shadow of an airplane, but he felt as if he had seen a dazzling light.

“Sir, I feel that we should consider the whole process of four centuries as a single entity and distinguish what is urgent from important. But please rest assured that I know you've got more factors in mind than just me. ”

The superior acknowledged your long-term thinking and commended you. The document stressed that reinforcements for the future project have not been blocked, but research and development on the plan will continue without any hindrance, provided that the conditions for implementation are still immature. In my opinion, of course just a personal viewpoint, it might be necessary to wait for more competent political personnel to join so as to alleviate some of the currently existing work pressure before considering this matter further.
You know, for space soldiers and political officers to be considered qualified, they have to meet the most basic requirements. Nowadays, however, not more but fewer such individuals are appearing.

But we should look forward. If the two key technologies of the first stage, which are space elevators and controlled fusion, breakthrough – which is likely to happen within our lifetimes – then hopefully this would be better. . . Anyway, time for a nudge-nudge.

After saluting to Chang Baihai, Zheng WeiSi turned around and went up the ladder. Once inside the cabin, his first impression was that it didn't seem too different from commercial jets except for its wider seats designed specifically for space travelers in their spacesuit.
In the first few flights of the unmanned spaceplane, crew members were required to wear space suits while taking off, but now this is no longer necessary.

He sat down in a window seat and immediately another person sat next to him. Based on his clothing, he was not a soldier. He gave the newcomer a quick gesture before focusing all his attention on fastening the complicated safety belt on his own seat.

Without a countdown, the "Hao Bingjian" launched its aircraft engine and started to take off. Due to its weight, it took longer than normal airplanes for the landing slide. But in the end, it still heavy left the ground and embarked on the space voyage.
This is the 38th flight of the ‘Gao Bian Jiang’ spaceplane. The aero-spaceflight phase has begun, lasting about thirty minutes. Please do not unfasten your safety belts during the flight.

Staring out the porthole, Zhang Beihai reminisces about his past. In naval aviation training school, he underwent complete pilot training for a naval fighter, and passed the assessment test of being promoted to junior lieutenant in the air force.
During his first solo flight, he looked at the earth departing and suddenly realized that he liked blue sky more than ocean. Now, he is longing for a better place in space.
He is destined to soar towards the sky and go far away.
Are they really the same as flying by airplanes?
He turned to look at the person sitting next to him and recognized him as Dr. Ding Yi. "Is it you, Dr. Ding? I have heard of your great reputation!", said Zhhang Beihai.

But I felt uncomfortable after a while… …Dingyi didn't care about Zhang Beihai's respect, continued to say, "I hadn't taken off my glasses on the first flight and they felt like bricks in my nose. During the second trip, however, I took them off and it flew away. Fortunately, we finally found it on a filter net at the back of the aircraft."
You were probably the first to go up in a spaceship. From TV, it seems like that journey wasn't very enjoyable.
Ah, I was talking about the space shuttle. It's the fourth time now, and the glasses were taken away before the takeoff of the space shuttle mission last time.
“This time you will be heading to the Space Station. You have just been appointed as the Project Leader of the third research branch, focused on controlled fusion.”
The CHIME Project has four research branches, each of which is focused on different research areas.

“Ding Yi raised a finger and pointed at Zhang Beihai. “Research of controlled nuclear fusion cannot be conducted in space? How can you argue with them like that?” She exclaimed angrily. “Our ultimate research objective is the engine for the cosmic spaceship. Now, there are many people who used to be engaged in developing chemical rocket engines and now they have great influence in the aerospace field, according to their thinking, only old-fashioned researchers like us should stay on the ground and work on controlled nuclear fusion, whereas there is little room for discussion regarding the overall plan for cosmic fleet.”

“Dr. Ding, I completely agree with your view on this matter,” said Zhang Beihai after relaxing the safety belt a little bit and leaning forward to speak. “The intergalactic space travel of the Space Fleet is not at all comparable to modern chemically powered spaceflight, nor does it fit into current space travel concepts in terms of the Space Elevator, yet those people in the space industry hold an excessive level of influence over this area and their thinking remains rigid and outdated. This may lead to disasters down the road.”
“Well, they did this in five years,” Ding Yi pointed to the four corners of her room. “So it just makes their discrimination against outsiders more acceptable.”

“Please fasten your seat belts. We are approaching two thousand meters altitude, which will cause a brief period of weightlessness due to low atmospheric pressure. Please remain seated and follow instructions.”
“But this time we are not going to the space station for a controlled fusion project, but to retrieve some very expensive detectors of cosmic rays,” said $丁仪。
“The space-based high energy physics research program has been discontinued.” said Zhang Beichen as he fastened his seat belt.
“Enough is enough. It’s pointless to keep trying now, it will be a successful outcome anyway.”
Chizhi won.
“Yeah, right now, that's all we have: classical physics, quantum mechanics, and strings theory in the womb. How far can we go with these theories?”

The “Great Frontier” continued to climb, its engines making a straining noise like it was scaling a mountain peak but without losing altitude. The aeronautical spaceplane was approaching three thousand meters, which is the limit of aerial flight. Zhāngběihǎi hànjiàn到，外面蓝天的色彩正在褪去，天空黑下来，但太阳却更加耀眼了。

“The plane is currently at an altitude of 31,000 meters. The end of the aviation stage has been reached, and we are entering the space flight stage. Please adjust your seat according to the instructions on the screen and relieve yourself from any discomfort caused by weightlessness.”
At this time, Zhang Beihai felt the plane lightly rising slightly, like a burden had been thrown off.
The countdown to the rocket engine ignition has begun.
“For them, this is just the real launch,” said Ding Yi. She then closed her eyes.

As the countdown to zero came, a loud roaring sound was heard, it seemed like the entire sky outside was howling with rage. The super heavy vessels hold everything as if it were clenched in their giant palm. Chapter North Sea looked out of the window of the bridge, he could not see the engine's flames, but the sky was already reddened, “high border front” was floating like a fairy tale in the thinner air.
Five minutes later, the booster was disconnected and after another five minutes of acceleration, the main engine was switched off. The "High Edge" orbiter entered orbit.
“Dad, I have taken my first step.”
For the past five years, General Fitzi has felt like a wallfacer. The walls he faces are stars in the cosmos of Three-Body Universe as photographed on a big screen.

For this patch of stars, Fizzle has been familiar with it. During a boring meeting yesterday, he tried to draw the positions of those stars on paper and checked them later against reality. Three stars of Trisolar System are located at the center of star field, very low in visibility but can only be found after being magnified several times. Such random cosmic dances fascinate him so much that he has forgotten himself initially looking for something else. Five dust clouds have been detected during five centuries-long voyage of Trisolar Fleet passing through them. The dust clouds are now called "snow" and their meaning is that the trail left by the traveler can be found on the snow surface.
If the Three-Body fleet had been accelerating at a constant rate for five years, it would have arrived today.
Fritz arrived at the Hubble Space Telescope control center early, and Ling laughed when she saw him.
General, why do you look like a child who just got presents?
You said you were going to go through the snow.
Not bad, but the Three-Body fleet is only traveling 0.22 light years away at present, reflecting that it will take four more years for its transmitted information to reach us from there.
“Oh, I forgot about that,” FizzRod embarrassedly shook his head. “I’m so eager to see them again and measure their speed and acceleration during their journey. This is really important.”
There's no way, we are beyond the light cone.
What?

Imagine now that there are a huge number of significant events taking place in the universe, and you have no way to know about them unless they happen at or close to the light speed. Even then, you can only know what is happening at any one point in time on the axis of time, which physicists call “the light cone”. So we are still in the dark regarding the vast majority of important events that have occurred in the past and will continue to occur in the future. This explains why we don’t have a complete view of reality.
“Inside the light cone is destiny.”
Lin Gongluo thought for a moment, then nodded approvingly to Fi Zhiro. “General, this analogy is very good!”
However, Zhizi can see what is going on inside the cone outside of it.
He looked at the image processing terminal and said, "So Yizizi changed his fate."
Luckily, people like him are not common.
